intro: Corchorus hirtus, commonly known as hairy touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Despite its ornamental value, it is also known for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
